fields.name: Positioning Errors
fields.description: Errors related to patient positioning, anatomical alignment, and radiographic technique that result in inadequate diagnostic images requiring retakes.

fields.name: Exposure Errors
fields.description: Incorrect exposure parameters leading to over-exposed or under-exposed images that do not meet diagnostic quality standards.

fields.name: Patient Identification
fields.description: Errors in patient identification, wrong patient studies, or missing/incorrect patient markers and demographics.

fields.name: Equipment Malfunction
fields.description: Hardware failures, mechanical issues, or equipment malfunction that result in poor image quality or examination failures.

fields.name: Calibration Issues
fields.description: Equipment calibration problems affecting image quality, dose accuracy, or measurement precision in radiographic examinations.

fields.name: Grid And Collimation
fields.description: Problems with anti-scatter grids, collimation errors, or beam alignment issues affecting image quality and radiation protection.

fields.name: Image Processing
fields.description: Digital image processing errors, software glitches, or incorrect image enhancement parameters affecting final image quality.

fields.name: Network And Transfer
fields.description: Network connectivity issues, DICOM transfer failures, or data corruption during image transmission to PACS systems.

fields.name: Storage Media
fields.description: Issues with image storage media, corrupted files, or problems with image archiving and retrieval systems.

fields.name: Patient Factors
fields.description: Patient-related factors beyond technical control including motion, cooperation issues, physical limitations, or medical conditions.

fields.name: Environmental Factors
fields.description: External environmental conditions affecting examination quality such as power fluctuations, temperature, humidity, or emergency situations.

fields.name: Urgent Circumstances
fields.description: Emergency or urgent clinical situations where standard protocols may be compromised due to patient condition or time constraints.
